# Introduction to rqti

The `rqti` package is designed to be a powerful, stand-alone R library
for creating exercises, exams, and questionnaires that fully comply with
the [QTI v2.1
standard](https://www.imsglobal.org/question/qtiv2p1/imsqti_implv2p1.html).
This tool empowers users to generate QTI-compliant content directly from
R, offering the flexibility to render tasks locally (using qtijs) or
seamlessly integrate them into learning management systems like OPAL.

Our primary target audience includes instructors specializing in
research methods and statistics who want to leverage R’s capabilities
while adhering to the QTI standard. In particular, those utilizing OPAL
will find `rqti` especially beneficial, as it fully leverages OPAL’s
robust API for smooth integration. However, the package is also suitable
for other learning management systems that support the QTI standard.

The versatility of QTI goes beyond exercises and exams; it also supports
the creation of comprehensive questionnaires, making `rqti` an
invaluable tool for a wide range of educational and research
applications.

## Installation

The `rqti` package is available on CRAN, ensuring easy installation and
access to its features:

``` r
install.packages("rqti")
```

## Quick start

In RStudio, start by navigating to *File* -\> *New Project*, and then
select **rqti Project** as the project type. For a quick start, you can
proceed with the default settings. If you prefer to customize the
options, make sure to select *YES* for *Create Templates*—this will
generate RMarkdown templates tailored for different task types.

Once your project is created, open one of the templates from the working
directory (e.g., `gap/gap.Rmd`). To preview it, simply click *Knit*. The
output will be displayed in the RStudio Viewer or in a new browser
window if you are working outside of RStudio.

Explore the other templates to familiarize yourself with the various
features and task types that `rqti` supports. This will help you create
tasks that align with your specific needs.

To learn how to create sections and tests, start by reviewing the
*main.R* file in your working directory. This file provides a
foundational understanding of structuring your work. For more detailed
information, you can refer to the article [Sections and
Tests](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/articles/section.md).

To add more templates, create a new RMarkdown file. In RStudio, go to
*File* -\> *New File* -\> *R Markdown* -\> *From Template*, and choose
one that ends with {rqti}. The simpler templates focus on basic
parameters, while the more advanced templates showcase additional
settings and customization options. After selecting a template, click
the *Knit* button to render the task in the viewer pane.

While the templates are generally intuitive, you can refer to other
articles of the documentation for detailed guidance on specific task
types. This will help you fully utilize the features of `rqti` for your
projects. The following task types are available:

- [Single-Choice
  tasks](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/articles/singlechoice.md)
- [Multiple-Choice
  tasks](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/articles/multiplechoice.md)
- [Essay tasks](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/articles/essay.md)
- [Gap tasks](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/articles/gap.md)
- [Dropdown
  tasks](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/articles/dropdown.md)
- [Order tasks](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/articles/order.md)
- [Directed Pair
  tasks](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/articles/directedpairs.md)
- [Table tasks](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/articles/table.md)

To add metadata to your tasks, refer to the article [Adding
metadata](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/articles/adding_metadata.md).
To integrate various tasks into a test, refer to the article [Sections
and Tests](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/articles/section.md). For
users of the learning management system OPAL, explore the article
[Working with the OPAL
API](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/articles/api_opal.md).

## General workflow

The fundamental workflow with the `rqti` package involves the following
steps:

1.  Create task files.
    - Start by generating an Rmd document. You can either start from
      scratch or leverage Rmd templates ending with the suffix
      [rqti](https://github.com/shevandrin/rqti).
    - Create a section titled `# question` and construct your
      interactions (gaps, choices, etc.) Utilize `rqti` helper functions
      where applicable.
    - Specify additional attributes in the yaml section. Detailed
      explanations for all types are available in the **Articles** menu
      on this website (top).
    - Choose a previewer: Either qtijs (`knit: rqti::render_qtijs`), for
      local rendering, or the learning management system Opal
      (`knit: rqti::render_opal`). Note that Opal usage requires prior
      setup, which is explained in the article [Working with the Opal
      API](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/articles/api_opal.md).
    - Verify if your task appears as desired. Make adjustments until you
      are satisfied.
2.  Create sections and tests based on your task files.
3.  Write the test (xml) to disk according to the QTI standard and
    upload the test file to your learning management system.
4.  Download results data from your learning management system and
    import them with the `rqti` package for statistical analysis.

Each step involves specific `rqti` functions, with the most useful ones
illustrated in the following diagram:

![Basic workflow to create tasks and tests with
rqti](articles/images/workflow.png)

Basic workflow to create tasks and tests with rqti

The most effective way to grasp the workflow is to create a simple task,
such as *Single-Choice* as demonstrated in the article [Single-Choice
tasks](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/articles/singlechoice.md). Once
you have completed that, explore the other task types discussed in the
subsequent chapters.

## Support and Bug Reports

Should you find any missing features or encounter issues, please do not
hesitate to inform us via email (<shevandrin@gmail.com>) or open an
issue on GitHub (<https://github.com/shevandrin/rqti/issues>). We will
offer support until the project’s funding concludes in September 2024.
Following that, we will maintain a stable, usable version, with support
for new features provided as time permits.

# Package index

## All functions

- [`AssessmentItem-class`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/AssessmentItem-class.md)
  [`AssessmentItem`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/AssessmentItem-class.md)
  : Class AssessmentItem
- [`AssessmentSection-class`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/AssessmentSection-class.md)
  [`AssessmentSection`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/AssessmentSection-class.md)
  : Class "AssessmentSection"
- [`AssessmentTest-class`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/AssessmentTest-class.md)
  [`AssessmentTest`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/AssessmentTest-class.md)
  : Class "AssessmentTest"

  [`AssessmentTestOpal`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/AssessmentTestOpal-class.md)
  : Class "AssessmentTestOpal"
- [`Choice-class`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/Choice-class.md)

  : Class "Choice"

- [`createResponseProcessing()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/createResponseProcessing-methods.md)
  : Create an element responseProcessing of a qti-xml document

  : Compose a set of html elements to display question in qti-xml
  document
- [`createZip()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/createZip-methods.md)
  : Create an Zip archive of QTI test
- [`create_assessment_item()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/create_assessment_item.md)
  : Compose a root element AssessmentItem of xml task
- [`create_qti_task()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/create_qti_task.md)
  : Create XML file for question specification
- [`create_qti_test()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/create_qti_test.md)
  : Create XML file for exam test specification
- [`create_question_object()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/create_question_object.md)
  : Create rqti S4 AssessmentItem Object from Rmd
- [`directedPair()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/directedPair.md)
  : Create object DirectedPair
- [`dropdown()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/dropdown.md)
  : Create YAML string for InlineChoice object (dropdown list)
- [`entry()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/entry.md) :
  Create object Entry
- [`essay()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/essay.md) :
  Create object Essay
- [`extract_results()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/extract_results.md)
  : Create data frame with test results
- [`gap_numeric()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/gap_numeric.md)
  : Create YAML string for NumericGap object
- [`gap_text()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/gap_text.md)
  : Create YAML string for TextGap object
- [`getAssessmentItems()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/getAssessmentItems-methods.md)
  : Get list of AssessmentItems for AssessmentSection
- [`getCalculator()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/getCalculator-methods.md)
  : Get value of the slot 'calculator'
- [`getContributors()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/getContributors-methods.md)
  : Get list of contributors values
- [`getCourseElements()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/getCourseElements-methods.md)
  : Get elements of the course by courseId from LMS
- [`getCourseResult()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/getCourseResult-methods.md)
  : Get zip with course results by resource id and node id
- [`getFiles()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/getFiles-methods.md)
  : Get file paths for attachment of test
- [`getIdentifier()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/getIdentifier-methods.md)
  : Get identifier
- [`getLMSResourceURL()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/getLMSResourceURL-methods.md)
  : Create an URL using the resource's display name on LMS
- [`getLMSResources()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/getLMSResources-methods.md)
  : Get records of all current user's resources on LMS
- [`getLMSResourcesByName()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/getLMSResourcesByName-methods.md)
  : Get select records about user resources by name.
- [`getObject()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/getObject-methods.md)
  : Get object
- [`getPoints()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/getPoints-methods.md)
  : Get points from AssessmentItem object
- [`getResponse()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/getResponse-methods.md)
  : Get and process a piece of question content
- [`inlineChoice()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/inlineChoice.md)
  : Create object InlineChoice
- [`isUserLoggedIn()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/isUserLoggedIn-methods.md)
  : Check if User is Logged in LMS
- [`mdlist()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/mdlist.md) :
  Create a markdown list for answer options
- [`modalFeedback()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/modalFeedback.md)
  : Create object ModalFeedback
- [`multipleChoice()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/multipleChoice.md)
  : Create object MultipleChoice
- [`multipleChoiceTable()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/multipleChoiceTable.md)
  : Create object MultipleChoiceTable
- [`numericGap()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/numericGap_doc.md)
  [`gapNumeric()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/numericGap_doc.md)
  : Create object NumericGap
- [`oneInColTable()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/oneInColTable.md)
  : Create object OneInColTable
- [`oneInRowTable()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/oneInRowTable.md)
  : Create object OneInRowTable
- [`opal()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/opal.md) :
  Create an Opal LMS Connection Object
- [`ordering()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/ordering.md)
  : Create object Ordering
- [`prepareQTIJSFiles()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/prepareQTIJSFiles-methods.md)
  : Prepare files to render them with QTIJS
- [`prepare_renderer()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/prepare_renderer.md)
  : Prepare qtijs renderer.
- [`publishCourse(`*`<Opal>`*`)`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/publishCourse-Opal-method.md)
  : Publish a course on LMS Opal
- [`publishCourse(`*`<missing>`*`)`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/publishCourse-missing-method.md)
  : Publish a course on LMS
- [`publishCourse()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/publishCourse.md)
  : Publish a course on LMS
- [`qtiContributor()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/qtiContributor.md)
  : Constructor function for class QtiContributor
- [`qtiMetadata()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/qtiMetadata.md)
  : Constructor function for class QtiMetadata
- [`qti_contributor()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/qti_contributor.md)
  : Constructor function for class QtiContributor
- [`qti_metadata()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/qti_metadata.md)
  : Constructor function for class QtiMetadata
- [`qtijs_pkg_path()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/qtijs_pkg_path.md)
  : Shortcut for the qtijs path of the rqti package local installation.
- [`render_opal()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/render_opal.md)
  : Render Rmd directly in Opal via API
- [`render_qtijs()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/render_qtijs.md)
  : Render an Rmd/md/xml file or rqti-object as qti xml with qtijs.
- [`render_xml()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/render_xml.md)
  : Render a single xml file with qtijs.
- [`render_zip()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/render_zip.md)
  : Render a zipped qti archive with qtijs.
- [`rmd2xml()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/rmd2xml.md)
  : Create qti-XML task file from Rmd (md) description
- [`rmd2zip()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/rmd2zip.md)
  : Create test zip file with one task xml file from Rmd (md)
  description
- [`section()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/section.md)
  : Create a section as part of a test content
- [`singleChoice()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/singleChoice.md)
  : Create object SingleChoice
- [`start_server()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/start_server.md)
  : Start qtijs renderer as a local server.
- [`stop_server()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/stop_server.md)
  : Stop QTIJS local server
- [`test()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/test.md) :
  Create a test
- [`test4opal()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/test4opal.md)
  : Create a test for LMS OPAL
- [`textGapOpal()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/textGapOpal_doc.md)
  [`gapTextOpal()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/textGapOpal_doc.md)
  : Create object TextGapOpal
- [`textGap()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/textGap_doc.md)
  [`gapText()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/textGap_doc.md)
  : Create object TextGap
- [`updateCourseElementResource(`*`<Opal>`*`)`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/updateCourseElementResource-Opal-method.md)
  : Update the referenced learning resource of a course element in the
  LMS Opal
- [`updateCourseElementResource(`*`<missing>`*`)`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/updateCourseElementResource-missing-method.md)
  : Update the referenced learning resource of a course element in the
  LMS
- [`updateCourseElementResource()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/updateCourseElementResource.md)
  : Update the referenced learning resource of a course element in the
  LMS
- [`upload2LMS()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/upload2LMS-methods.md)
  : Upload content to LMS
- [`upload2opal()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/upload2opal.md)
  : Upload a resource on OPAL
- [`verify_qti()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/verify_qti.md)
  : Verify QTI XML against XSD Schema QTI v2.1
- [`wrongFeedback()`](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/reference/wrongFeedback.md)
  : Create object WrongFeedback

  Model](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/articles/rqti_oop_model.md):

  Systems](https://shevandrin.github.io/rqti/articles/compatibility.md):
